page.title: 08COUNCIL YARD
page.content: The Council Yard is on the site of the old railway station in Bellingham. The building is still there and is now used as an office for the{highways} section of the County Council in this area. The stationmaster used to live above the waiting room and ticket office. Parcels were stored in a big shed with two doors.This is now used to keep oil and grease for the council vehicles. There is toolshed which used to be the old signal box. The road{vehicles} kept here are a snow blower,snow plough,gritters,diggers,tractors,vans and a tar layer. There are only eleven men working here now.They look after the roads in all weather conditions from Wark 5 miles south of bellingham to Carter Bar on the Scottish border.
